Trigger.Name: Party List Settings - copy to Startup Folder

Action.Description: Party List Position - Move this aura to where you want the initial auras to appear. Note: If the pictures in this aura don't line up well in your party list, you will need to edit the vertical padding variable action, or change your party list element size in your FFXIV HUD.
Padding value - how much horizontal space to put between each icon (only edit if you want them to be closer together or farther apart)
Padding value - how much vertical space to put between each icon (only edit if the auras are not lining up well with your party list)
Aura grow direction: -1 is left, 1 is right

Trigger.Name: ## INSTRUCTIONS - SEE DESCRIPTION TAB
Trigger.Description:
These triggers are based on Dansa's DoT and HoT triggers, with some additional customization and utility added by SableCentaur. Make sure your party list order in FFXIV matches your configured party order in Triggernometry's settings. Copy the Party List Settings in your Triggernometry startup folder and disable it in the remote repository. Open the settings trigger and configure it by moving the Position auras to where you want the auras to appear. - use the visual guide for placement to place the auras, but don't change any other settings in the action. Each of the other actions in these triggers are labeled as to what settings they change. If you don't understand what they do, just leave them alone.
To turn off auras for abilities you don't care about, find the relevant ability in folders inside the DO NOT EDIT folder and enable/disable the trigger. Don't edit the triggers inside there, just enable/disable as you need. All of these triggers are designed for use at level 90; I don't plan to support them at levels below that, but if you find they don't work and fix it, feel free to send me a DM explaining what the issue was and how you fixed it.
Support for these triggers is limited, but questions may be DM'd to SableCentaur#1297 on Discord. If your question is answered in these instructions or in Triggernometry's FAQ, I will not answer.
